summary: Cory Lambert is a wildlife officer who finds the body of an 18-year-old woman on an American Indian reservation in snowy Wyoming. When the autopsy reveals that she was raped, FBI agent Jane Banner arrives to investigate. Teaming up with Lambert as a guide, the duo soon find that their lives are in danger while trying to solve the mystery of the teen's death.

reviews.content: Wish the end would've been drawn out a little, got a little more frontier justice. Other than that great movie.
Good frontier justice movie.

I just re watched this movie after 3 years and it still holds up. You know the silence of  a snowfall in the middle of the night?  It's kind of beautiful and yet creates a sense of unease at the same time.  I can't explain it but that's how this movie makes me feel while watching it.  I fast forwarded through the rape scene this time because it just seems way too real and makes me want to throw up.  Whole scene juts hurts my heart.  Love Taylor Sheridan, I think he's proven that he knows what he is doing.

A pretty great mystery movie with main characters who are easy to get attached. Elisabeth Olsen and Jeremy Renner do an excellent job with their character, both of their performance are engaging. The movie is about how hard and unfair it is to live in the Native reserve in the cold North, it's maybe even too harsh sometimes painting characters that have lost will to live, that have to fight unfair battle just because they are born there.  

The movie is sometimes hard to watch. The snowy mountains surrounding the movie is a threat for the eyes but also enhance the cold truths of the movie.
Fantastic - horrifying, suspenseful, savage, and glides nicely through a frozen landscape..... one of the best thrillers I've seen in the last 10 years.
Great film, liked the cast. Well told story with some brilliant scenes which were very dense. Overall a (surprisingly) good film.

Jeremy Renner at his best. Fabulous character back story to film plot. Excellent cinematography, gorgeous back drops of land and nature.
Great story that involves indigenous actors in several main character roles.
I've seen this film at least 4 times now over the last few years and it never looks dated.
Highly recommended 🏆
Hauntingly beautiful film. Tells a story that needs to be told. Tough but important. Terrific acting by Jeremy Renner.

All in all, it's a pretty great movie with a great storyline and great acting and it is so well made that honestly after watching it (I don't usually become emotional or affected by movies, but) the rage that I felt at rapist after watching this honestly shows that it's well made

Wind River is a grounded vignette of the reality that is the MMIW epidemic, and yet, is also an eye-for-an-eye reverie— one that draws in the audience, swells our righteousness, and consequently punches the air from our lungs with the reminder that this fictitious portrayal sees more justice for its victim than thousands of real women and families ever will.

Seemed like a respectful treatment and a movie made with quality about the plight of missing Native American women. What impactful scenery - though Utah doubled for Wyoming. Curious that it was a Louisiana tribe which financed the movie.
Very good story lineup and realistic

this is a great movie that opens the viewers eyes to the many missing native woman that still have not been found. the cinematography is amazing as well as the writing of the characters. definitely recommend.
There are about 10 movies that I consider perfect. This is hands down one of them. Not a single flaw in the movie.

Given shape by its cast who ultimately just have to replay an old tale of "wise injured veteran" helps "rookie apprentice" convincingly (and do), this murder mystery breaks some rules, not really in a good way, before reaching its predictable conclusion, but does it faithfully, creating a 'not bad' atmosphere throughout. It kind of wants to be Fargo, but ends up being a half-decent episode of Columbo.
Brilliant film really enjoyed... Good plot with excellent revenge

Excellent film the acting directing scenery all first rate 
treats native Americans as real people not props
Amazing thriller. Great acting and edge of your seat writing. Great all around movie if you like a murder mystery with depth.
Slow, predictable and uninteresting.

I think that the Movie called Wind River is extremely good. It was exciting and thrilling to watch but still informative about a topic that isn't talked about a lot and is not something that happened a lot of time ago but is still happening today. The only thing I didn't like about it was that it was very hart to follow from time to time, but if you actively try to follow it was clear. I would defiantly recommend to watch the movie, but only to people who are not sensitive concerning brutality.

As i watched the movie i was very dragged in and had a tense feeling. It was a true thriller and the actors made a great performance! After the beginning it was a little peaceful and calm but some scenes at the middle and end part of the movie were extremely thrilling and especially the one were Natalie and her boyfriend got beaten.
The end was a 10/10 too. It was very satisfying to see a raper and murderer left on his own fate. I didn't like that literally everyone died at the end and only the hunter survived. After all I would rate the movie a solid 8/10.

The movie is good and interesting, but I would only recommend it to people over 16, because some scenes are brutal and have other elements that could be/are disturbing for younger people. 
The overall topic is about the harassment, the brutality and the unfairness against native Americans in North- America (and the world), which is important to know about.
But I still would recommend the movie even though it is brutal, because it shows the truth.
I really enjoyed this thriller/miystery movie. It was truly dramatic, engaging and mysterious. The hunt was very interesting to watch, and the brutal shooting scenes I also found emotional.
I find the plot very confusing and boring but the execution was great, the actors were great and the cinematography was good. The beginning was hard to pick up on. its aight.
I really liked this movie and because it is based on a true story it gets even scarier. It was very educational and slightly horrifying but still good.

This movie took a quite unexpected turn and is for sure mind-altering. The fact that it is based on a true story highlights the relevance of this movie and makes it a must-watch. Nevertheless, before watching this movie, it is worth acknowledging the fact that it is rather violent and definitely not a family movie.
the movie was really good! I would totally recommend the movie to anyone. it was informative and I learned a lot.

Mundane and callous violence that is both heartbreaking and visceral, Wind River is a  movie that should disturb you because it does nothing to make the violence lurid or cinematic... just human. Brilliantly filmed and acted. Highly recommended.
Great watch-entertaining

This movie is haunting, powerful and masterfully directed. 

Taylor Sheridan really shows his directorial chops here, compelling the audience to face painful truths and to expose the plights of those socially and economically bound to the reservation. Sheridan's writing additionally makes phenomenal use of and interpretation of the gritty cop/fish out of water tropes. 

In turn, Elizabeth Olsen gives a believable performance as green FBI agent, trying to solve the case or get back to her office--whichever comes first. Jeremy Renner's bona fides as a brooding, grief-stricken hardman are only furthered here, as he struggles to find redemption and find some sort of peace. Renner's chemistry with Graham Greene's Ben brings to life a backstory and rapport between the two that is as fully-fleshed as it is unspoken. 

This modern western is beautifully shot and my lasting memory are the well-timed use of wide shots to show that this story's protagonists are largely alone, and that sometimes vengeance must be undertaken in a cold-far away place from one's humanity. The film declines to pass moral judgment on whether this path of vengeance and redemption is good or bad; but it highlights that for this to be the only way to get justice, these people, this reservation, are far removed from what society would deem appropriate. And that is the larger tragedy in this film, and what makes it so hard to watch, but for all the right reasons.
Great Movie. Olsen and Renner are great.

Powerful...Just Powerful. Phenomenal Grounded Acting. Fantastic Cinematography, Amazing Editing & Pacing the Whole way through. the tension just keeps building and building to a fantastic climax. This is a rare thriller with a message to it and it never once feel self righteous. A very simple plot but richly layered characters and the environment serves as its own character. The soundtrack is phenomenal also. This is a All Time Classic Thriller and All Time Classic in General.

This is a fairly dark film, although it is in a snowy setting,  so visually at times its somewhat light I suppose but its fair to say there are some dark thematic elements and sexual violence is depicted, so its not a film that will suit everyone, its fair to say. The plot is a little slow to build but it is fairly atmospheric and at the end some information is given by way of text, which I thought was interesting. Its somewhat thought provoking, a bit bleak but not a bad film as such. I wouldn't, however, actively recommend it as such, no.
4 years ago- While it starts off slow, the slow burn western noir finishes strong by continual use of it's gorgeous but harsh setting and it's two strong leads.

An intense thriller that plays off the good relationship between Elizabeth Olsen and Jeremy Renner. A murder mystery that makes you want to put the gloves on and dive in with this awesome cast. Fun, thrilling, and a satisfying ending
This is one of the most powerful movies ever made.
Yip, good story , well told

Stellar performances from the entire cast. I would recommend. It's a well-done film. The story, writing, character development, acting, cinematography, the overall mood of this film - it's all there. Wind River evokes emotion, it has plenty of action, mystery, it's pretty dark, too. It's a satisfying crime drama.
Renner at his best and a good murder mystery based around the native Indian sub culture. The perpetration of the gun violence reminded me of Peckinpah. Nice cameo for the wilderness also.
Featuring some commonly placed costars, this indie flick has enough action and drama for any thriller fan to enjoy.
Words can't explain how I enjoyed that movie. 20 minutes gone and I gave up the movie and start fading out. That's the only sad thing about it i's really slow burn but I enjoyed the plot.
Hurt locker and Hawkeye are his best roles not wind river guy

Going in expecting the usual mystery thriller, Wind River surprises with its several underlying themes of loss, redemption, justice, and determination to prove oneself. Jeremy Renner excels at his portrayal of a father who lost his child while Elizabeth Olsen is effective in her role as a young woman still looking to prove her worth, with the two eventually finding their own redemption.

I've watched this film a long time ago...

And this second time, Wind River, 2017, makes me moving a lot...

In particular, the scene when Jeremy Renner expresses his same feelings comforts to Gil Birmingham for his loss of daughter...
Fun mystery/thriller. Greatly enjoyed the deep base soundtrack. Climax sneaks up on you, resolves very tightly and quickly.
que excelente pelicula, solo con ver el cast ya te dabas una idea de lo buena que puede llegar a ser, hay una escena en particular que te causa un suspenso increible.

Wind River is a brutal, tense, and thrilling crime mystery/neo-western that has killer performances by Renner, Olsen, and the rest of the supporting cast. Don't expect an action packed ride, but when the action hits- it is brutal, realistic, and unflinching. There is one scene that will understandably put many viewers off from watching (involving rape), it is extremely disturbing. There is also a lot of heart and soul, and it is clearly made with the intent of showing the plight of native populations stuck in a cycle of crime and drugs on America's remote and poorly developed reservations
A movie keeping you rivetted for justice to be served.
I was pleasantly surprised at the good quality of the story, and the acting in this movie. Definitely a must see.

Wow, I put this on to kill time and it turned out to be one of the best movies I have seen in a while. This is the type of movie that takes you somewhere you have never been before and makes you feel like you are standing next to the characters. No fluff, powerful ending. A+
